title: What's considered average CS after 20 mins?
body:
I know the average CS is 10CS/min when you're laning, but considering roaming, objectives and group pushing, how does this decrease as mid game and late game approaches? I tend to get 120-180 CS at 20 mins but it stagnates to 150-210 CS by 30 mins. Then I split push and get to around 240 CS by 40 mins.

Are you expected to maintain the 150-200 CS per 20 mins rule the entire game, even when pushing to nexus and grouping?

replies.body: It depends on the champ you're playing to be honest. As a mid lane main, if I'm playing Ahri, a roamer with good waveclear, I'll end up with about 120-130 by 20.  As Ori or Viktor, I don't roam much and just farm and I end up with about 150-160 by 20. As LB I roam a fucktonne and I have minimal waveclear and I end up with about 100-ish by 20.
LeBlanc, even without roaming is extremely hard to cs with too, unless you use abilities, which wastes your mana. 100 isn't too bad by 20, I usually end up with a lot less than that.

Well if the wave sits right, a W-R will clear the whole wave. R is free and is on a very short cooldown and W is also on a short cooldown. I don't do it all the time, only when I wanna back or need to clear the wave for some reason as you need these two abilities up for skirmishes and what not.
I do that too, but as mentioned they do have cooldowns meaning you do have to cs a bit with auto attacks, which is hard to do. I agree though.
Well... Yeah most csing is done with autos lol

What about afterwards? How should I keep up with CSing by the time teamfights start?

Also I heard LeBlanc's auto attacks have a great animation or something like that, is it really normal to CS with abilities (when farming specifically and not pushing is the goal) because I always use auto attacks even on Anivia and Soraka (not supp Soraka).

That is something I tend to sometimes struggle with also to be honest with you. I find that just being aware of the minimap's waves helps and doing Raptors whenever you can.

Yes they definitely do! One of the best out of all AP Mid laner's I've ever played. Yes it perfectly normal, few reasons why you would do it. Let's use Leblanc as an example. In lane phase you might want to farm with W because there are two or three really low minions next to each other and you wouldn't have gotten them all otherwise. Or you farm with Q because you AA'd the minion too early and you'd miss it otherwise (quicker animation). Or try and waveclear as fast as you can because you wanna buy (always do this). Or you want to make sure the enemy laner misses out on gold and exp since they are at a roam. Or YOU wanna roam. General rule of thumb, whenever you're leaving lane, shovr first.

I was always aware of shoving the lane (which is why I said farming and not pushing in my comment) but had no clue on using abilities to farm when auto attacks won't get them all. Thanks for the advice
Yeah it's a good thing to master. If you auto'd too early, you cancel your AA animation with an ability and get that juicy gold
If it is less than 75 and they are not support, getting camped, jungling or getting kills they are probably a noob....
I think 75 as the line for 20 mins is a bit low of an expectation.
nah, its a good enough expectation, just on the line. but 95 is fine too.

I'm pretty sure the ADC and top should get at least 130 by 20 mins (And usually a lot more) and mid should get at least 110(depending on the champion), because 95 is really, really low. I only get that much in games where I'm camped or if I'm laning against a hard matchup.

And this is the line between noob and being pretty bad still. Missing 30-60 CS is a lot

I average about 40-90 cs a game. I do main support though… ;)

As a mid I usually end up with around 300 by 40 minutes. As a top laner or split pusher, that will usually be a bit higher. Some games don't last that long though, or you're busy fighting other enemies, so as long as I'm over 200 cs and it's a win, I'd say that's more or less average.

well it depends on the champ  on {{champion:62}} il have about 150 to 200 cs by 20 min but with someone like {{champion:7}} il have 100 to 150 as the game goes on you will make more cs faster as well as your wave clear gets beter on most champs

What about {{champion:34}} {{champion:90}} ? I tend to get around {{champion:62}} level CS

Okay I think I need to make the title more specific: What CS should you gain after 20 mins.
average bronze 100 average silver 150 average gold 100 to 150 average after that is 95% of cs unless pushed out of lane
150-200 depending on skill level and the game itself.
Cs is overrated.  Get a coin and watch the money roll in.
